question.text: The reaction of cyanamide, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>NH</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>CN</mi><mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></mfenced></msub></math> with oxygen was run in a bomb calorimeter and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>ΔU</mi></math> was found to be <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>-</mo><mn>742</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>24</mn><mo> </mo><mi>kJ</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mi>mol</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> . The magnitude of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>ΔH</mi><mn>298</mn></msub></math> for the reaction  <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi>NH</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>CN</mi><mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></mfenced></msub><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></mfenced></mrow></msub><mo>→</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></mfenced></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></mfenced></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mfenced></msub></math> is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>kJ</mi></math>. (Rounded off to the nearest integer) [Assume ideal gases and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>314</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi><mo> </mo><msup><mi>mol</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo> </mo><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>]

data.bucket: Must Do Ques (JEE Main) - Any Difficulty
